1: <sup>1</sup> Whoso loveth instruction loveth knowledge: but he that hateth reproof is brutish.
2: <sup>2</sup> A good man obtaineth favour of the LORD: but a man of wicked devices will he condemn.
3: <sup>3</sup> A man shall not be established by wickedness: but the root of the righteous shall not be moved.
4: <sup>4</sup> A virtuous woman is a crown to her husband: but she that maketh ashamed is as rottenness in his bones.
5: <sup>5</sup> The thoughts of the righteous are right: but the counsels of the wicked are deceit.
6: <sup>6</sup> The words of the wicked are to lie in wait for blood: but the mouth of the upright shall deliver them.
7: <sup>7</sup> The wicked are overthrown, and are not: but the house of the righteous shall stand.
8: <sup>8</sup> A man shall be commended according to his wisdom: but he that is of a perverse heart shall be despised.
9: <sup>9</sup> He that is despised, and hath a servant, is better than he that honoureth himself, and lacketh bread.
10: <sup>10</sup> A righteous man regardeth the life of his beast: but the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.
11: <sup>11</sup> He that tilleth his land shall be satisfied with bread: but he that followeth vain persons is void of understanding.
12: <sup>12</sup> The wicked desireth the net of evil men: but the root of the righteous yieldeth fruit.
13: <sup>13</sup> The wicked is snared by the transgression of his lips: but the just shall come out of trouble.
14: <sup>14</sup> A man shall be satisfied with good by the fruit of his mouth: and the recompence of a man’s hands shall be rendered unto him.
15: <sup>15</sup> The way of a fool is right in his own eyes: but he that hearkeneth unto counsel is wise.
16: <sup>16</sup> A fool’s wrath is presently known: but a prudent man covereth shame.
17: <sup>17</sup> He that speaketh truth sheweth forth righteousness: but a false witness deceit.
18: <sup>18</sup> There is that speaketh like the piercings of a sword: but the tongue of the wise is health.
19: <sup>19</sup> The lip of truth shall be established for ever: but a lying tongue is but for a moment.
20: <sup>20</sup> Deceit is in the heart of them that imagine evil: but to the counsellors of peace is joy.
21: <sup>21</sup> There shall no evil happen to the just: but the wicked shall be filled with mischief.
22: <sup>22</sup> Lying lips are abomination to the LORD: but they that deal truly are his delight.
23: <sup>23</sup> A prudent man concealeth knowledge: but the heart of fools proclaimeth foolishness.
24: <sup>24</sup> The hand of the diligent shall bear rule: but the slothful shall be under tribute.
25: <sup>25</sup> Heaviness in the heart of man maketh it stoop: but a good word maketh it glad.
26: <sup>26</sup> The righteous is more excellent than his neighbour: but the way of the wicked seduceth them.
27: <sup>27</sup> The slothful man roasteth not that which he took in hunting: but the substance of a diligent man is precious.
28: <sup>28</sup> In the way of righteousness is life: and in the pathway thereof there is no death.
